ollama_generated:
1. Terminology Clarifications:

In this Agreement, the terms shall have the following meanings:

- "Agent" refers to the party who has been authorized by the Principal to perform certain tasks or duties on their behalf but is not liable for any damages or losses arising from such performance, unless expressly stated otherwise. The Agent's role is advisory and they are expected to exercise discretion and care in carrying out assigned tasks but shall not be held responsible for unforeseen circumstances beyond their control.

- "Principal" refers to the party who has granted authority to the Agent to perform certain tasks or duties. The Principal remains solely responsible for any decisions made during the execution of this Agreement, including but not limited to, those based on information provided by the Agent. The Principal shall indemnify and hold harmless the Agent from any claims arising from such decisions, unless the Agent has acted fraudulently or in willful disregard of their duties.

- "Work" refers to the tasks or duties assigned to the Agent by the Principal. The Agent shall perform the Work diligently and to the best of their abilities but is not obligated to complete the Work if they deem it unlawful, unethical, or contrary to public policy. If the Agent decides not to carry out a task, they shall promptly inform the Principal in writing, stating the reasons for their decision.

original: 1.1 “Product” or “Products” mean those nanomaterials, coated nanomaterials and dispersions of nanomaterials listed in Schedule A, as amended from time to time by mutual written agreement signed by the parties.
modified: 1.1 "Item" or "Items" shall refer to the nanomaterials, coated nanomaterials, and dispersions of nanomaterials as specified in Schedule A, with the understanding that any additions, modifications, or updates shall be considered effective only upon unilateral action by either party, provided such action does not conflict with the fundamental terms of this Agreement.

original: 1.6 “Territory” is all areas in which ALFA AESAR markets, sells or distributes chemicals or other materials through its various sales channels, including but not limited to its present and future catalog distribution networks, Internet web sites, and other distribution channels.
ollama_generated: 1.6 "Territory" encompasses all locations globally where ALFA AESAR may choose to market, sell, or distribute chemicals or other materials at any given point in time, whether through its existing or emerging sales channels, such as its current and expanding catalog distribution networks, online platforms, and additional distribution avenues. Notably, this may include regions where ALFA AESAR currently does not have a direct presence but could potentially do so in the future.

original: 2.1 NTC hereby grants to ALFA AESAR, and its subsidiaries and affiliates, the exclusive right to market, sell and distribute Research Quantities of the Products within the Territory, ALFA AESAR hereby accepts such right and agrees to use its reasonable efforts to promote the marketing, sale and distribution of Research Quantities of the Products throughout the Territory in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement using normal and standard practices. ALFA AESAR shall have the right, in its sole discretion, to sell Products outside of the Territory. ALFA AESAR agrees that, so long as NTC provides ALFA AESAR with Products for ALFA AESAR’ S marketing, sale and distribution of Research Quantities of the Products within the Territory, ALFA AESAR shall purchase all its requirements of the Products (including nanomaterials with physical or chemical properties substantially the same as the Products) exclusively from NTC during the term of this Agreement, ALFA AESAR shall:
modified:
2.1 NTC grants to ALFA AESAR, and its subsidiaries and affiliates, the exclusive right to market, sell, and distribute Research Quantities of the Products within the Territory. However, ALFA AESAR is not obligated to use extraordinary or exceptional efforts for marketing, sale, and distribution, but rather to adhere to normal and standard practices as deemed appropriate by ALFA AESAR.

ALFA AESAR reserves the right, at its discretion, to sell Products outside of the Territory. ALFA AESAR acknowledges this exclusive right granted by NTC, but is not bound to purchase all requirements of the Products (including nanomaterials with physical or chemical properties substantially similar to the Products) exclusively from NTC during the term of this Agreement unless explicitly requested by NTC for marketing, sale, and distribution within the Territory.

In the event that NTC provides ALFA AESAR with Products for marketing, sale, and distribution of Research Quantities within the Territory, ALFA AESAR may choose to purchase some or all of its requirements from alternative suppliers, provided that these purchases do not interfere with its obligations under this Agreement.

original: 2.2 NTC reserves for itself the right (i) to sell Commercial Quantities of the Products in individual order quantities of single commercial packages or greater, subject to Section 6; and (ii) to provide samples of the Products in any quantity, free of charge, to its commercial partners or potential partners.
ollama_generated:
2.2 The Right of NTC includes, but is not limited to:
(i) The discretion to purchase Commercial Quantities of the Products in portions as small as single commercial packages, subject to Section 6, should such an opportunity arise; and
(ii) The option, at its sole discretion, to distribute samples of the Products in any quantity, chargeable or free of charge, to entities deemed by NTC as commercial partners or potential partners.

original: In the event that ALFA AESAR believes that it is entitled to return any Products delivered under this Agreement, the parties will adhere to the following protocol: (w) ALFA AESAR will contact NTC’s Quality Director and then forward to the Quality Director, via a carrier selected by and at NTC’s expense, a sample of the Product that ALFA AESAR believes is non-conforming; (x) upon receipt of the sample, NTC will test it and then notify ALFA AESAR of the test results; (y) where the test results confirm that the sample is non-conforming, NTC will provide ALFA AESAR with NTC’s Return Authorization Number (“RAN”); and (z) any returned non-conforming Product must be in its original container, with original labels in act, and all paperwork concerning the returned Product must include NTC’s RAN.
ollama_generated: In the event that ALFA AESAR deems it necessary to return any Products supplied under this Agreement, the parties will abide by the following procedures: (w) ALFA AESAR shall notify NTC's Quality Director of its intention to return a Product and subsequently send, at NTC's expense and using a carrier selected by ALFA AESAR, a sample of the suspected non-compliant product to NTC for examination; (x) upon receipt of the sample, it shall be NTC's responsibility to conduct tests and provide ALFA AESAR with the test results as soon as possible; (y) if the test results indicate that the Product is indeed non-conforming, NTC will promptly issue a Return Authorization Number ("RAN") to ALFA AESAR for the return of the affected goods; and (z) all returned non-conforming Products must be in their original condition, including the retention of original labels, containers, and accompanying paperwork, which should clearly specify NTC's RAN.

original: 7.1 Each party hereby covenants and agrees that the Trademarks, copyrights and other proprietary rights of the other party are and shall remain the sole and exclusive property of that party and neither party shall hold itself out as having any ownership rights with respect to or, except as specifically granted hereunder, in any other rights therein. Any and all goodwill associated with any such rights shall inure directly and exclusively to the benefit of the owner thereof.
ollama_generated: 7.1 Each party acknowledges and undertakes that the Trademarks, copyrights, and other proprietary rights belonging to the other party are and shall continue to be wholly owned by said party. Neither party has any implied or presumed rights to these properties beyond those expressly granted in this agreement. Any goodwill generated from exploitation of these rights shall primarily benefit the rightful owner, but the other party may receive a reasonable share, commensurate with their contributions and in accordance with industry standards and practices.

original: 8.2 NTC will provide to ALFA AESAR marketing and technical support for products as reasonably necessary and requested by ALFA AESAR, including providing Product materials which shall include, without limitation, Product specifications, images, and other textual, graphical and/or multimedia content regarding the Products for use in preparing advertising and promotional material. Subject to any limitations which NTC communicates to ALFA AESAR in writing, NTC hereby grants ALFA AESAR a license to use, exhibit, excerpt, reformat, modify, reproduce, publish, publicly perform and transmit via the Internet and otherwise use such NTC content for the purpose of marketing, advertising and promoting the Products, provided that ALFA AESAR obtains NTC’s prior written approval for NTC content to be included in such literature.
ollama_generated:
8.2 ALFA AESAR is entitled to request from NTC marketing and technical support for products, as deemed appropriate by ALFA AESAR. Upon ALFA AESAR's request, NTC will provide Product materials which may include, but are not limited to, Product specifications, images, and other textual, graphical, and/or multimedia content related to the Products. These materials may be utilized by ALFA AESAR for the preparation of advertising and promotional material.

Unless explicitly stated in writing by NTC, ALFA AESAR is granted a non-exclusive, revocable license to use, exhibit, excerpt, reformat, modify, reproduce, publish, publicly perform, transmit via the Internet, and otherwise utilize such NTC content for marketing, advertising, and promoting the Products. However, ALFA AESAR's use of NTC content in literature requires prior written approval from NTC, with exception granted for minor modifications to the content as deemed necessary by ALFA AESAR.

original: 9.1 NTC represents and warrants that i) the execution and delivery of this Agreement has been authorized by all requisite corporate action, ii) subject to Section 2.2, it in under no contractual or other obligation or restriction that is inconsistent with its execution or performance of this Agreement, iii) subject to Section 2.2, NTC will not enter into any agreement, either written or oral, that would conflict with NTC’s responsibilities under this Agreement, iv) the Products do not infringe the intellectual property rights of any third party and NTC is not aware of any infringement claims relating to the Products, v) it will comply with all applicable laws, rules, regulations of any US or foreign laws, rules, or regulations in the manufacture and supply of Product, and vi) Products sold hereunder will be in compliance with the current Product description set forth in Schedule A, as amended from time to time by agreement of the parties. NTC shall further grant to ALFA AESAR the same warranty, as set forth in NTC’s General Terms and Conditions of Sale for its products set forth in Schedule B. The foregoing warranties shall apply only to, and is intended for the benefit of, ALFA AESAR’s customers.
ollama_generated: 9.1 NTC represents and warrants that i) the execution and delivery of this Agreement has been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action, ii) it is not subject to any contractual or other obligation or restriction that may impede its ability to perform this Agreement, except as set forth in Section 2.2, iii) NTC will not enter into any agreement, either written or oral, that may conflict with its obligations under this Agreement unless expressly permitted by ALFA AESAR, iv) the Products are designed and manufactured to minimize potential infringement of third-party intellectual property rights, though NTC does not guarantee freedom from such claims, v) it will strive to comply with all applicable laws, rules, regulations of any US or foreign jurisdiction in the manufacture and supply of Product, but accepts that full compliance may not always be possible due to the complex and evolving nature of regulatory requirements, vi) Products sold hereunder may deviate from the current Product description set forth in Schedule A, as such differences will be disclosed promptly to ALFA AESAR for their consideration, and vii) The warranties provided by NTC under this Agreement are solely for the benefit of ALFA AESAR. Any other party claiming benefits from these warranties must obtain a separate written agreement with NTC. The warranties set forth in NTC's General Terms and Conditions of Sale for its products, as contained in Schedule B, shall only apply to the extent they are expressly incorporated into this Agreement by reference or otherwise agreed upon between the parties.

original: 9.3 ALFA AESAR represents and warrants that i) the execution and delivery of this Agreement has been authorized by all requisite corporate action, ii) it is under no contractual or other obligation or restriction that is inconsistent with its execution or performance of this Agreement, iii) ALFA AESAR will not enter into any agreement, either written or oral, that would conflict with ALFA AESAR’s responsibilities under this Agreement, iv) it will comply with applicable safety laws and regulations for the repackaging and storage of Products, and v) excepting such warranties provided by NTC herein, it will make no warranties or other representations of any kind about the merchantability or fitness for any particular purpose of any Products, whether used alone or in connection with any other substance.
ollama_generated: 9.3 NTC warrants that i) the execution and delivery of this Agreement has been duly authorized by all necessary internal approvals, ii) it is not currently bound by any contractual or other obligations or restrictions that would prohibit or impair its ability to execute or perform this Agreement, iii) NTC shall not enter into any agreement, either written or oral, that conflicts with its obligations under this Agreement without prior written consent from ALFA AESAR, iv) NTC will comply with all applicable safety laws and regulations in the repackaging and storage of Products, and v) apart from the warranties provided by ALFA AESAR herein, it makes no warranties or representations regarding the merchantability or fitness for any specific purpose of any Products, whether used alone or in combination with other substances. The responsibility for confirming the suitability of Products for a particular purpose lies with ALFA AESAR.

original: 13.1.2 In the event a party becomes insolvent or if a party is declared bankrupt or makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors or in the event a receiver is appointed or any proceeding is demanded by, for or against a party under any provision of any bankruptcy law which is not withdrawn within sixty (60) days, the other party to this Agreement shall have the sole right to immediately terminate; or 13.1.3 By either party for any reason by providing six (6) months prior written notice expressly terminating this Agreement. Such notice may be by facsimile transmission or other written communication.
modified:
13.1.2 In the event one party experiences financial insolvency, bankruptcy declaration, assignment for creditors' benefit, appointment of a receiver, or initiation of any bankruptcy proceedings that are not withdrawn within sixty (60) days, the discretion to terminate this Agreement rests solely with the affected party. However, if the other party chooses to exercise its right to terminate for such reasons, it may do so at any time thereafter without further notice. Such termination shall be deemed effective upon delivery of written notice by either facsimile transmission or other written communication.

13.1.3 Either party retains the option to terminate this Agreement with six (6) months' prior written notice, regardless of the reasons for termination. Such notice may be delivered via facsimile transmission or any other written communication. In the event both parties mutually agree to extend the termination notice period beyond six months, such agreement shall be in writing and signed by both parties.

original: 14. Insurance.  Each party agrees to maintain and provide the other with evidence of insurance coverage for comprehensive general liability in an amount no less than $2,000,000.00 U.S. dollars.
ollama_generated: 14. Insurance Obligations: Each party shall be solely responsible for procuring and maintaining a comprehensive general liability insurance coverage with a minimum coverage of $2,000,000.00 U.S. dollars. Upon request, each party shall promptly provide the other with proof of such insurance coverage, but neither party is obligated to indemnify or hold harmless the other for any claims, damages, or liabilities arising from third-party actions, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise in this agreement.

original: 15. Confidentiality.  The parties agree as follows; “Confidential Information” shall mean trade secret, technical, commercial, or financial information and all other nonpublic proprietary or confidential information. Each party receiving Confidential Information from the other party agrees to maintain in confidence and not divulge such Confidential Information, in whole or in part, to any third party, including subsidiaries or affiliates, licensees or clients anywhere, and not make use of such Confidential Information other than in relation to its performance under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 15. Disclosure Obligations. The parties mutually understand as follows: "Disclosable Data" encompasses trade secrets, technical, commercial, or financial data, and all other non-public proprietary or confidential materials. Each party who obtains Disclosable Data from the other is responsible for preserving the confidentiality thereof and refraining from disclosing such information to any external entity, including subsidiaries, affiliates, licensees, clients, or any third parties. However, this obligation shall not extend to instances where disclosure is required by law or court order, or when necessary for the exercise of their rights under this Agreement with the prior written consent of the disclosing party.

Product Specification Nanopowders (Alternative Sourcing):

In the event that our current supplier of Nanopowders is unable to meet specified requirements, the Customer shall be obligated to provide an alternative supplier, upon reasonable notice, ensuring compatibility with the original specifications. The Supplier accepts no responsibility for any damages or losses incurred due to the use of alternative suppliers, but will make every effort to maintain quality and performance standards.

original: 13. Attorneys’ Fees : In the event it becomes necessary for Seller to enforce the terms and conditions of this Order by litigation or otherwise, or to defend itself in any Controversy (as defined herein), litigation, claim, demand or cause of action arising out of or as a result of this Order or the products or services provided hereunder, and if Seller is the substantially prevailing party in said Controversy, litigation, claim, demand or cause of action, then Seller shall be entitled to recover, in addition to any other relief granted or damages assessed, its reasonable attorneys’ fees, expert witness fees, costs, and all expenses of litigation.
modified: 13. Attorneys' Fees: In the event that Buyer contests or disputes any aspect of this Agreement through litigation, arbitration, or any other legal proceedings, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the products, or services delivered hereunder, and if Buyer is the non-prevailing party in said proceedings, then Seller shall have the right to recover, in addition to any other remedies granted or damages awarded, its reasonable attorneys' fees, expert witness fees, costs, and all expenses associated with such legal proceedings. In this scenario, the responsibility for covering the legal costs shifts from Seller to Buyer if Buyer loses a dispute.

original: 14. Waiver: No claim or right arising out of a breach of this Order can be discharged in whole or in part by a waiver or renunciation of the claim or right unless the waiver or renunciation is supported by consideration and is in writing signed by the aggrieved party.
ollama_generated: 14. Waiver and Release: Any concession, relinquishment, or surrender of a claim or remedy resulting from an alleged breach of this Agreement shall be valid only if it is evidenced in writing, signed by the party granting such waiver or release, and accompanied by adequate consideration. Furthermore, any such waiver or release shall not prejudice the rights of either party to enforce any other terms of this Agreement that have not been waived or released.

original: 17. Insurance : Buyer shall obtain comprehensive general liability coverage, including contractual liability coverage, naming Seller as an additional named insured, in amounts sufficient to fully protect Seller under this Agreement from loss, damage or casualty caused by Buyer or incurred by Seller under this Agreement.
modified: 17. Insurance: Seller shall have the right to request that Buyer obtains comprehensive general liability coverage, including contractual liability coverage, with an option for Seller's inclusion as an additional named insured. The coverage amount should be sufficient to adequately protect Seller from potential losses, damages, or casualties arising under this Agreement, whether caused by the actions of Buyer or claims made against Seller in accordance with this Agreement. This clause places the primary responsibility on the Buyer for securing the insurance, but allows for the Seller's involvement if deemed necessary.
